title: The real reason nobody likes Riven and Yasuo is because they have nothing to manage in lane
body:
Both have insanely low cooldowns and no long windows when you can fight them

Riven being able to keep up her Q's because of how the cooldown works and Yasuo's everything

Other champions have to manage mana, cooldowns where they're very vulnerable (when Jax's E is down), or some other resource (Tryndamere and Renekton being much weaker when they don't have fury stacked up)

Riven and yasuo have none of this, so it makes fighting them frustrating even when they aren't top tier

replies.body: My main issue is that they decide when a fight happens and 99% of the time you can't.

This is an important aspect of all forms of fighting, which riot really never seems to address in the game's balance. 

#Initiative.
The reason champions like {{champion:92}} {{champion:64}} {{champion:157}} {{champion:238}} {{champion:103}} are so popular when they are anything more than total trash, is because they ALWAYS have the initiative. To lose the initiative on these champions in a 1v1 requires multiple mistakes in sequence, and the appropriate response from the enemy, assuming they even can.

Take a champion with no CC and no Mobility like {{champion:82}}, as an extreme fringe case. The ONLY way that any of these champions die to him, is to commit, misplay, and miscalculate his damage output.

I wouldn't say {{champion:103}} fits as much as the others do. Yes, her Charm has a good 975 range or whatever, but it can still easily be dodged or countered, like {{champion:157}}'s Wind Wall. Just standing behind minions can let you engage before she does. This is coming from a level 7 Ahri main, by the way.

On a side note, these are very fair points, and it's really why champions like {{champion:82}} could use some buffs. Another example of this was pre-rework {{champion:83}}.

Her Q and Ult make her ultra-safe, the E is just icing on the cake. Her and the other champs can disengage so reliably AND have very strong sticking, that they can choose to only fight favorable fights and almost can't be fought on your terms. Leblanc is similar as well.
So many times I've seen an Ahri who gets caught just use her ult as a get out of jail card because she knows it'll be back up again pretty quickly, assuming flash is down.
So much this. And even if they pock a bad fight, if you Lack Just 5% damage needed for a kill, they Just dash away like nothing happened.
This is retarded. Of course they have things to manage during laning phase, even if it's not a resource. Yasuo has his shield, his Q stacks, his E stacks, and his dashes on individual targets.

All he has to do is walk around to get his shield.

You call that management? lol

Trading without your shield will lose you the lane. That means you have to play differently when it's down. The good Yasuo's will go in to trade right as it refreshes so they can use it without getting it poked off. That's absolutely managing it.
Well that's true, unless you get a slight lead and then have the power to force a kill onto the lane opponent if they even step out of tower range to farm.
You definitely need more than a slight lead to zone people that hard. And he's certainly not as good at it as many champions I could name.

You really don't depending on the champion you're against. The CD on his 3xQ against melee champions means he can effectively zone most without some form of dash. Not to mention it also acts as an initiation tool and instantly refreshes his shield, no matter the range.

I'd agree. Both Yasuo and Riven have really low downtimes that make them extremely unapproachable. 

And as a matter of fact, both Yasuo and Riven as an example have really high uptime in terms of extra damage or cc pressure. Riven has her auto damage from her passive, and Yasuo has his cc which he can keep up for 10 seconds every time.

This makes them both excellent top laners.
That's beyond absurd. Riv and Yas aren't frustrating because they can't run oom. Competent players don't run oom.

You dumb? Some champs can't trade without blowing a crapload of mana on a combo. Like jax, for instance. If you just sit there and farm, sure, you won't run out of mana, but if you actually fight, you run out really fast. This is why resource-less champs with low cd are a problem. They can FORCE a trade, their opponent uses up their mana, then they have a huge advantage.

It's certainly not the ONLY reason why riven and yasuo are hated, but it certainly contributes to it.
that's true but in yasuo's case mid lane, he risks his HP when he tries to go in, compared to most mages who are safer when trading. throwing out a spell doesn't cost anything except mana.
If only he had a shield that pops up the moment he takes damage, or a special wall that cancels any projectile that was thrown at it, oh if only Yasuo was built to deal with mages in the mid lane.

duh that's why he has moments when he can trade well, and then when you trade with him when those aren't up you win. that's like, basic design philosophy for the champs, you give them windows they're strong and windows they're weak.

That's the thing, the lack of resources and low cooldown on his spells, means his window of opportunity is MUCH slower than other champions, so unless you have a point and click hard control that can't be stopped by his wall, you're not going to be able to make use of the small windows he live, but if he wants to punish you he doesn't have to wait until you blow something up, he can engage and disengage as he wants, he chooses the fights he will be in, and unless he FUCKS UP you're not going to be able to punish him.
